key_channel_insights.line_content: OTA listings achieved 93.3% price parity last week with fewer higher-fare instances (2.23%) and improved coverage (96.76% availability), underscoring strong distribution alignment.
MSE delivered lower fares on 95.8% of itineraries with a negligible –0.08% average gap, reinforcing its position as the primary discount channel.
GDS fares exceeded website rates on 97.09% of itineraries with a modest 0.42% average markup, highlighting consistent premium positioning.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: OTA listings matched website fares in 93.30% of cases last week, up 1.44 p.p. week-over-week and 3.94 p.p. month-over-month.
Instances of higher OTA fares fell to 2.23% last week, down 1.24 p.p. week-over-week and 2.87 p.p. month-over-month, with a 0.19% average markup.
Missing-offer frequency contracted to 3.24% last week, improving 0.23 p.p. week-over-week and 0.89 p.p. month-over-month.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: OTA listings were missing for 3.24% of O-Ds last week, improving 0.23 p.p. week-over-week and 0.89 p.p. month-over-month.
Par OTA matched website fares in 93.30% of listings last week, rising 1.44 p.p. week-over-week and 3.94 p.p. month-over-month.
OTA offered higher fares in 2.23% of cases last week, down 1.24 p.p. week-over-week and 2.87 p.p. month-over-month, with a 0.19% average markup.
OTA presented lower fares in 1.23% of listings last week, with a 0.07% average markdown and minimal week-over-week and month-over-month shifts.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes saw 93.46% parity last week (+1.16 p.p. W/W, +4.05 p.p. M/M), with 2.06% priced higher (+0.17% markup) and 1.15% priced lower (–0.04% markdown).
Long-haul parity rebounded to 86.96% last week (+11.96 p.p. W/W) with 8.70% higher by 0.34% and 4.35% lower by 0.26%, reflecting greater price swings.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: OTA parity out of Austria was 93.91% last week (+1.74 p.p. W/W, +2.60 p.p. M/M); higher fares occurred in 2.17% of listings with a 0.08% markup.
For non-Austrian origins, OTA parity stood at 92.64% last week (+1.33 p.p. W/W, +5.14 p.p. M/M); higher pricing occurred in 2.30% of cases with a 0.32% markup.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in windows saw 93.46% parity last week (+1.69 p.p. W/W, +4.11 p.p. M/M) with 1.80% higher (+0.14% markup) and 1.14% lower (–0.06% markdown).
Far-out bookings had 92.28% parity last week (+0.56 p.p. W/W, +2.61 p.p. M/M); 3.16% were priced higher (+0.26%) and 1.75% priced lower (–0.08%).

mse_highlights.line_content: 95.8% of itineraries on MSE were priced below the website last week, up 2.1 p.p. week-over-week and 2.5 p.p. month-over-month.
Average price difference on MSE held at –0.08% last week, consistent with prior weekly and monthly levels.
Under 4% of listings were exact-match or unavailable, with exact-matches down and missing offers marginally up versus the month prior.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: MSE missing-offer rate was 2.68% last week, down 0.14 p.p. week-over-week and up 0.69 p.p. month-over-month.
Only 1.56% of MSE itineraries matched website fares last week, down 1.91 p.p. week-over-week and 1.48 p.p. month-over-month.
MSE lower-fare share reached 95.75% last week, up 2.05 p.p. week-over-week and 2.49 p.p. month-over-month.
No MSE itineraries were priced higher last week, consistent with the prior week and near zero versus last month (0.33%).

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes saw 95.98% of fares lower on MSE last week, up 2.22 p.p. week-over-week and 2.67 p.p. month-over-month.
Long-haul routes had 87.50% of fares lower on MSE last week, down 3.80 p.p. week-over-week yet remaining a strong discount channel.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For Austrian origins, 96.75% of fares were lower on MSE last week, improving 3.72 p.p. week-over-week and 4.80 p.p. month-over-month.
Non-Austrian origins maintained 94.70% lower-priced fares on MSE last week, largely flat versus week and month comparisons.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in itineraries saw 95.42% lower pricing on MSE last week, up 0.59 p.p. week-over-week and 1.39 p.p. month-over-month, with an average –0.10% gap.
Far-out bookings achieved 96.48% lower fares on MSE last week, up 5.09 p.p. week-over-week and 4.78 p.p. month-over-month, with a –0.04% average difference.

gds_highlights.line_content: 97.09% of GDS itineraries carried higher fares last week, rising 0.14 p.p. week-over-week and 0.25 p.p. month-over-month.
Average GDS markup remained at 0.42% last week, consistent with the monthly level of 0.43%.
Only 2.68% of itineraries were unavailable on GDS and 0.11% offered lower fares (0.08% average discount).

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 2.68% of itineraries were not found on GDS last week, down 0.14 p.p. week-over-week and 0.47 p.p. month-over-month.
0.11% of fares matched website prices on GDS, unchanged week-over-week and up 0.11 p.p. month-over-month, with a 0.01% average difference.
97.09% of itineraries carried higher GDS fares last week, up 0.14 p.p. week-over-week and 0.25 p.p. month-over-month, with a 0.42% average premium.
Only 0.11% of fares were cheaper on GDS, flat week-over-week and up 0.11 p.p. month-over-month, with a 0.08% average discount.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes saw 97.24% incidence of higher GDS fares at a 0.43% average premium, up 0.14 p.p. week-over-week and 0.48 p.p. month-over-month.
Long-haul itineraries were pricier on GDS in 91.67% of cases by 0.05%, while 4.17% were discounted by 0.08%.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 97.18% of Austrian-origin itineraries carried a GDS premium averaging 0.35%, stable week-over-week and up 0.35 p.p. month-over-month.
Non-AT origins showed 96.78% higher fares on GDS with a 0.51% premium, up 0.13 p.p. week-over-week and down 0.09 p.p. month-over-month.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings exhibited 96.89% higher GDS fares at a 0.36% premium, up 0.12 p.p. week-over-week.
Far-out bookings carried higher GDS prices on 97.54% of itineraries with a 0.56% premium, up 0.18 p.p. week-over-week but down 1.52 p.p. month-over-month.
